title: "Easy"/"ez" at the end of a match should be a zero-tolerance phrase
body: It is pure, unfiltered unsportsmanlike behavior. I hate when I'm on the losing team and it's said to me, and I hate when I'm on the winning team and one of my teammates says it. It is absolutely unjustifiable; there is no context in which it is acceptable.

But if you add 'EZ' to the list, you are essentially giving out the message that being a slight asshole towards your enemies is on the same level as telling someone to killthemselves.

The zero tolerance stuff has a reason it's treated with zero tolerance compared to other behavioral infractions.

Derogatory slurs? Offensive towards a group of people regardless of how it's used. Not things that should even be considered being said in a civilized conversation with strangers.

Telling someone to kill themselves? Telling someone to commit self-harm can be extremely distressing to anyone that's been (or is) on that edge or someone who has/had a family member in that situation. That disregard of any empathy by another human being can easily hit a lot harder than the speaker intends.

Telling someone that the game was easy? I don't see any reason that it should have an elevated punishment anymore than saying, "Your team sucked".

I'm getting downvoted because there are many people in this "community" who enjoy being rude and thus highly value the avenues to do so that are available to them. Saying that a match was "easy" is a concise way for a rude person to tell the enemy team that they are good and the enemy team is bad, whether the game was close or one-sided, and whether it was decided by a large skill gap, a small skill gap, luck, disconnects, etc. It's completely non-constructive. What is someone supposed to do with that information? Get better? That's already a goal for most players. And if they do get better, why, there'll be someone in the next elo up who'll take the mantle of saying "ez," so they can be informed once again that they're bad at the game and should stop being bad. "You suck" and "you need to work on control ward placement" are both criticism, but one is constructive while the other is not. I'll leave you to puzzle out which one is which.

Good luck on the Rift!
